required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase I Study to Assess the Absorption, Metabolism, and Excretion of [14C] Labeled SPN-810M
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Single-Dose, Mass-Balance Study to Assess the Absorption, Metabolism, and Excretion (AME) of [14C] Labeled SPN-810M in Healthy Adult Male Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: An Open-Label, Single-Dose, Mass-Balance Study to Assess the Absorption, Metabolism, and Excretion of Radio Labeled SPN-810M in Healthy Adult Male Volunteers

primary_outcome.measure: Urinary and fecal recoveries (mass balance) of total radioactivity.
primary_outcome.description: C(urine and feces), Ae(urine and feces), CumAe(urine and feces), % Dose(urine and feces), CUM% Dose(urine and feces).

secondary_outcome.measure: Whole blood and plasma partitioning of total radioactivity.
secondary_outcome.description: To determine whole blood and plasma partitioning of total radioactivity

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK) of total radioactivity in plasma.
secondary_outcome.description: PK of total radioactivity in plasma (Cmax, Tmax, AUC0-t, AUCinf, Kel, and t1/2).
PK of SPN-810 in plasma (Cmax, Tmax, AUC0-t, AUCinf, Kel, and t1/2).

secondary_outcome.measure: PK of the major metabolites of SPN-810 in plasma.
secondary_outcome.description: PK of the major metabolites of SPN-810 in plasma (Cmax, Tmax, AUC0-t, AUCinf, Kel, and t1/2).

secondary_outcome.measure: Metabolites of SPN-810 in plasma, urine and feces
secondary_outcome.description: To characterize and identify the metabolites of SPN-810 in plasma, urine and feces.
To assess the safety and tolerability of SPN-810 by collecting Adverse Events.

arm_group.description: Single dose of 20 mL solution containing 50 mg of SPN-810M and no less than 8.5 MBq (225 µCi) carbon-14 (14C)-SPN-810M, and no more than 11.3 MBq (305 µCi) [14C] SPN-810M.

criteria.textblock:
Key Entry:
1. Healthy males.
2. Aged 30 to 55 years.
3. Considered medically healthy by the Investigator via assessment of physical examination, medical history, clinical laboratory tests, urinalysis, vital signs, and electrocardiogram.
4. Able to voluntarily provide written informed consent to participate in the study.
